questions.question: Which of these pairs of events are INDEPENDENT?

choices.answer: It will rain today and it will rain tomorrow
The temperature and the amount you drink during the day
Oversleeping and being late for school
Throwing a dice and getting 6 twice in a row

questions.question: How did the tree diagram get its name?

choices.answer: It was invented by Mr Tree
The lines look like branches of a tree
The lines represent  the "less than" symbols
It was invented by Mrs Tree

questions.question: When would you need to draw a tree diagram (rather than a sample space)?

choices.answer: If you spin a coin twice
If you spin a coin three times
If you spin a coin four times
You don't have a pound to spin
School trips
Probabilites
You can never really be sure
The results after some event

questions.question: The probability it will rain tomorrow is 0.3, what fractions would appear on the tree diagram?

choices.answer: Impossible to know

questions.question: If you add up the probabilities of all possible outcomes which of these statements is true?

choices.answer: You get a proper fraction
You get an improper fraction
You get a mixed fraction
The total is always 1

questions.question: When would a tree diagram NOT be appropriate?

choices.answer: If there is only one outcome
If there are more than 5 outcomes
If there are more than 3 events
Questions that do not have the words dices or counters.
Probabilities are written along the branches
Outcomes are written at the end of branches
Outcomes are written along the branches
Probabilities are written at the end of branches

questions.question: If a coloured counter is taken from a bag and NOT REPLACED which statement is true?

choices.answer: The second counter must be same colour
The second counter must be a different colour
The probability of getting the same colour again is less
The probability of getting the same colour will increase

questions.question: Which of these has a probability of 1/8 when throwing a dice?

choices.answer: Getting a 6
Getting an even number twice in a row?
Getting an odd number 3 times in a row
Dropping the dice on the floor
